item.title: Learn Programming with Automation Apps
item.description: We’re in the age of STEM right now and everyone is screaming that “Everyone should learn to code” when what they really mean is that more people should learn how to program. Programming is a skill that will help most of us, as most of us deal with computers on a daily basis. Programmatic Thinking is a skill that will help almost anyone, because programmitic thinking is just problem solving in a systematic way.

item.title: Open Mic Tech
item.description: Keisha is the creator of Open Mic Tech, a quarterly community-driven event designed to facilitate communication among professionals, students, and hobbyists in tech-related fields. OMT is a place for people to come together and talk about the stuff they’re working on. Just as the name suggests, it’s an open mic night geared toward technology. At each event, members of the community are invited to share, through 5-15 minute lightning talks, some way that they’re using technology.

item.title: How One .PSD File Transformed My Workflow
item.description: I create a good deal of media for my church, and sometimes that media needs to be used in many ways. Perhaps the event flier that I create for a pre-service loop of slides needs to also be made to fit social media, or be printed and handed out. Up until recently I solved this issue by first designing something for the church’s presentation screen at a 16:9 ratio, then resizing and tweaking the design to meet whatever other needs where given to me.

item.title: The Powerful Illustrator Shape Builder Tool
item.description: When I began to foray into Adobe’s Creative Suite, I was using Photoshop for everything. Need a logo for lots of uses? Just deliver a huge PNG! Want to draw a nice crisp illustration? Photoshop’s pen tool works just fine for that, right? Photoshop was my one-stop for everything I needed, though none of what I needed was what Photoshop was created for. It was some time before I even considered using any of Adobe’s many great pieces of software that actually suited my needs, like Illustrator.

item.title: Top Five Sources for Free Assets
item.description: I think it’s fair to say that all of us have at one time or another needed to get a job done on a small–or sometimes non-existent–budget. At times like these, we scour the web for quality free and cheap design assets. This post will share my favorite sources for free assets. item.title: Welcome to KayEssPea Blog!
item.description: Hello, and welcome to my new blog! I decided that I wanted a blog, and so here it is. This will predominantly be a design and web development blog. I love to teach, and I like to write. So, I figured there’d be no better place to write the things I want to teach!

item.title: Moving Our Sprite 2
item.description: Key Press Move 2 canvas{ position: absolute; top: 50%; left: 50%; transform: translate(-50%,-50%); } var robot; function setup() { robot = createSprite(150,150,50,160); robot.addAnimation("idle", "../images/Idle01.png", "../images/Idle09.png"); robot.addAnimation("run", "../images/Run01.png", "../images/Run08.png"); createCanvas(800, 300); } function draw() { background('black'); if (keyIsDown(39)) { robot.velocity.x = 1; robot.changeAnimation('run'); robot.mirrorX(1); } else if (keyIsDown(37)) { robot.velocity.x = -1; robot.changeAnimation('run'); robot.mirrorX(-1); } else{ robot.velocity.x = 0; robot.changeAnimation('idle'); } drawSprites(); }

item.title: Up and Running With HUGO
item.description: Hugo is a great static site generator that's super fast and lightweight. This talk demos the steps for getting a site up and running, adding a few posts, and choosing a theme. I really recommend digging into the HUGO docs as well as the HUGO Community Forum for more in-depth explanations of how to use HUGO for your own site. There's also a great HUGO Tutorial Playlist by Mike Dane of the Giraffe Academy YouTube channel.
